item.title: MEV (Maximum Extractable Value)
item.description: What’s MEV? # It’s the value that blockchain node operators and users can extract by ordering transactions in a block in a specific order. When a transaction is initiated, it is directed to a specific node which, instead of immediately integrating it into its block, places it into its ‘memory pool’, or ‘mempool’ {waiting area for transactions}. This constitutes the lower tier of workings that enable blockchain. Suppose you’re a malicious user and want to use this to your advantage.
